title: About
text:
About this blog
Hi! My name is Lana Hebda and Iâ€™m a senior at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am currently majoring in Agricultural and Environmental Sciences Communication and Sports Media Communication while also minoring in Agribusiness and the Engler Entrepreneurial Program.

title: Who will be the team to root for in 2024?
text:
talk talk talk


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggalt)
library(ggtext)

pitching <- read_csv("pitching.csv") 


newpitching <- pitching |> 
  filter(SO9 >= 9 & W >= 90) 

rangespitch <- pitching |> filter(Tm == "Texas Rangers")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=pitching, aes(x=W, y=SO9), color="grey") +
  geom_point(data=newpitching, aes(x=W, y=SO9), colour="blue") +
  geom_point(data=rangespitch, aes(x=W, y=SO9), colour="blue") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 9) + 
  geom_vline(xintercept = 90) +
  geom_text_repel(data=newpitching, aes(x=W, y=SO9, label=Tm)) +
  geom_text_repel(data=rangespitch, aes(x=W, y=SO9, label=Tm)) +
  labs(
    x="Games Won", 
    y="Strike Outs per 9 Innings", 
    title="High Strike Outs, High Wins: Part of the Winning Formula in Baseball", 
    subtitle="Atlanta Braves have the best of both worlds with dominating on the mound and winning games.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By: Lana Hebda"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 







Code
batting <- read_csv("batting.csv")

hits <- batting |> 
  select(`Tm`, `2B`, `3B`, `HR`)

TeamBatting <- hits |> 
    pivot_longer(
    cols=-Tm, 
    names_to="Type", 
    values_to="Percentage")

ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=TeamBatting, aes(x=reorder(Tm, Percentage), weight=Percentage, fill=Type)) +
  scale_fill_manual(values=c("#414c66", "#617398", "#92ace5")) +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(
    x="",
    y="<span style = 'color:#414c66;'>Home Runs</span> versus <span style = 'color:#617398;'>Triples</span> versus <span style = 'color:#92ace5;'>Doubles</span>", 
    title="The Most Exciting Hits to Watch", 
    subtitle="The Three Powerhouses: Doubles, Triples, and Home Runs make for a more entertaining day at the ballpark.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By: Lana Hebda"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    axis.title.x = element_textbox_simple(halign = .5)
    ) 







Code
fielding <- read_csv("field.csv")

ggplot() + 
  geom_dumbbell(
    data=fielding, 
    aes(y=reorder(Tm, DP), x=E, xend=DP),
    size = 2,
    colour = "darkgrey",
    colour_x = "blue",
    colour_xend = "darkgreen") +
  labs(
    x="<span style = 'color:blue;'>Errors</span> versus <span style = 'color:darkgreen;'>Double Plays</span>", 
    y="", 
    title="Errors and Double Plays: The fine line between failure and success", 
    subtitle="The Giants have the most amount of errors in the league, but at least they don't have the least amount of\ndouble plays like the New York Yankees.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By: Lana Hebda"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    axis.title.x = element_textbox_simple(halign = .5)
    )
